Calculates all pairwise contrasts and omnibus tests for multinomial regression

Source: R/models.R
detailedTests.vglm.Rd

TODO: make me!

# S3 method for vglm
detailedTests(object, OR = TRUE, digits = 2L,
  pdigits = 3L, ...)

Arguments

object

A vglm class object, the fitted result of vglm(). At the moment only handles the multinomial family, although this may get expanded in the future.
OR

a logical value whether to report odds ratios and 95 percent confidence intervals, if TRUE, or regression coefficients on the logit scale with standard errors, if FALSE.
digits

An integer indicating the number of digits for coefficients, standard errors, and confidence intervals
pdigits

An integer indicating the number of digits for p-values.
...

Additional argument to match generic. Not currently used.

Value

A list with two elements. Results contains a data table of the actual estimates. Table contains a nicely formatted character matrix.

Examples


mtcars$cyl <- factor(mtcars$cyl)
m <- VGAM::vglm(cyl ~ qsec,
  family = VGAM::multinomial(), data = mtcars)
detailedTests(m)
#> $Results
#>    Ref Num Term          B        SE           P        LL         UL Comp
#> 1:   1   1 qsec -0.5795781 0.4006097 0.147969796 -1.364759  0.2056026    2
#> 2:   1   2 qsec -1.2697728 0.4560391 0.005363505 -2.163593 -0.3759525    3
#> 3:   2   2 qsec -0.6901947 0.4045653 0.088005136 -1.483128  0.1027386    3
#>      Labels
#> 1: 2 vs.\n1
#> 2: 3 vs.\n1
#> 3: 3 vs.\n2
#> 
#> $Table
#>      Variable 2 vs.\n1             3 vs.\n1               3 vs.\n2            
#> [1,] "qsec"   "0.56\n[0.26, 1.23]" "0.28**\n[0.11, 0.69]" "0.50\n[0.23, 1.11]"
#>      PValue                               
#> [1,] "Chi-square (df=2) = 14.21, p < .001"
#> 

rm(m, mtcars)

if (FALSE) {
mtcars$cyl <- factor(mtcars$cyl)
mtcars$am <- factor(mtcars$am)
m <- VGAM::vglm(cyl ~ qsec,
  family = VGAM::multinomial(), data = mtcars)
detailedTests(m)

detailedTests(m, digits = 4)$Table
detailedTests(m, OR = FALSE)
detailedTests(m, digits = 4, OR = FALSE)$Table

m <- VGAM::vglm(cyl ~ scale(qsec),
  family = VGAM::multinomial(), data = mtcars)
detailedTests(m)

m2 <- VGAM::vglm(cyl ~ factor(vs) * scale(qsec),
  family = VGAM::multinomial(), data = mtcars)
detailedTests(m2)

m <- VGAM::vglm(Species ~ Sepal.Length,
  family = VGAM::multinomial(), data = iris)
class(m)
detailedTests(m)
}
